intro: Dalechampia schizoloba, commonly known as the Schizoloba Dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and striking, yellowish-green cyathium inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
